subject: Medicine
title: The First Heart Surgery
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The First Heart Surgery.

hook.text: In 1893, a man was stabbed in the chest. A Black surgeon did what no one had dared: he opened the heart.

buildup.text: Daniel Hale Williams sutured the pericardium at Provident Hospital in Chicago without modern equipment.

discovery.text: The patient survived. Williams proved the heart could be surgically repairedâ€”a medical impossibility.

twist.text: Despite this breakthrough, Williams was largely forgotten by mainstream medical history for decades.

climax.text: His courage opened the door to all cardiac surgery that followedâ€”bypasses, transplants, valve repairs.

punchline.text: He opened a heart and opened a frontier.

quiz.question: What made Daniel Hale Williams's 1893 surgery historic?
options: He was the first to successfully operate on the heart
He invented a new type of anesthesia
He performed the first blood transfusion
